content: 20 general rule here is divide the number of 24 24 stitches remain you should now have 10 12 heel flap row by 2 and add 1 to determine 12 stitches on both needles number of gusset stitches for each side graft these remaining stitches together using the next knit across the heel stitches and the first set of kitchener stitch and your tapestry needle 16 18 18 gusset stitches at this point because you ve used stitchmarkers you can rearrange the finishing stitches as needed between the two needles to accommodate the gusset stitches weave in loose ends with tapestry needle you are now back at the beginning of the instep knit second sock stitches this is your new starting point block as needed © iknit2purl2 2016 iknit2purl2 com 3 variations change up your late night socks these variations change up the leg gusset and the foot of the sock follow the instructions above for the cuff heel flap gusset set-up and the toe note a little more yarn is used with these versions than with a plain vanilla sock variation #1 gusset row 1 -
